text:
It seems that Apache, when parsing the absoluteURI form of a Request-URI (<http://greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/draft-ietf-httpbis-p1-messaging-latest.html#rfc.section.5.1.2>), ignores the URI scheme.

So, both

GET /foo HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost

and

GET http://localhost/foo HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost

yield the same result, which is ok, but

GET foobar://localhost/foo HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost

returns it as well, which seems to be a bug.

Note IIS 5.1 returns a 501 in that case.
